title: Time-Limited Values

definitions.Vk(s): the optimal value of s if the game ends in k more time steps

formulas: Vk(s) = the optimal value of s if the game ends in k more time steps
summary: The slide discusses the concept of time-limited values in the context of a game, defining Vk(s) as the optimal value of s if the game ends in k more time steps. It also relates this to a depth-k expectimax algorithm.
